title: Immuno-pathology
author: ayobami
description: Review your knowledge of the various processes of the immune system

questions.question: Genes encoding HLA molecules are located on chromosome 9
Genes encoding HLA molecules are located on chromosome 6
The first step in immune response is antigen recognition
The first step in immune response is activation of specific lymphocytes
After antigen recognition, the next step in the immune response is specific lymphocytes' activation
Immediately following lymphocytes' activation, the activated lymphocytes eliminate the antigen
The next step following lymphocyte activation is proliferation into memory, and effector cells
60% of mature T cells are CD8+, and 30% are CD4+
60% of mature T cells are CD4+, and 30% are CD8+
Activation of naive T cells leads to autocrine stimulation with IL-3
Activation of naive T cells leads to autocrine stimulation with IL-7
Activation of naive T cells leads to autocrine stimulation with IL-2
Th2 CD4+ T cells secrete gamma-interferon
Th1 CD4+ T cells secrete gamma-interferon
Th1 CD4+ T cells secrete eotaxin
Th2 CD4+ T cells secrete IL-4 and IL-5
Th17 CD4+ T cells secrete IL-7 and IL-10
Th17 CD4+ T cells secrete IL-17
Th2 CD4+ T cells secrete eotaxin
IFN-γ's function is to recruit monocytes and neutrophils
IL-4's function is to recruit monocytes and neutrophils
IFN-γ's function is to recruit eosinophils
IFN-γ's function is to activate macrophages
IL-5's function is to recruit monocytes and neutrophils
IL-4's function is to stimulate differentiation of B cells into Ig-E secreting plasma cells
IL-17's function is to recruit monocytes and neutrophils
IL-2's function is to stimulate proliferation of newly-activated T cells
T-dependent B lymphocytes can only get activated when their CD-40 ligand binds to a CD-40 receptor on a CD4+ T cell
T-dependent B lymphocytes can only get activated when their CD-40 receptor is bound to by a CD-40 ligand on a CD4+ T cell
T-dependent B lymphocytes can only get activated when their CD-40 receptor is bound to by a CD-40 ligand on a CD8+ T cell
